subject: Re: [junit] OT: final
msgSnippet: ... I need to re-read this when I have more time. Still, I find that treating most object references as immutable makes for better code. Again, I can t
messageBody:
>So said Kevin Klinemeier on 2003-05-09 --------------------
>
>--- Mike Clark <mike@...> wrote:
>> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>> >In this case, my disciplined use of final helps the
>> compiler/interpreter/whatever optimize on my behalf, nothing more.
>>
>> Really? Have you measured the impact?
>
>I haven't read this whole thread, but I thought I'd chime in at this
>point. A friend of mine recently pointed me towards this document that
>claims that final doesn't get you faster:
>
>http://www-900.ibm.com/developerWorks/cn/java/j-jtp1029/index_eng.shtml
>
>It was written in October 2002, but I think its still accurate.

I need to re-read this when I have more time. Still, I find that treating most object references as immutable makes for better code. Again, I can't adequately express why, but I feel it.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
